comments.body:
I think string to any, not only ITranslateProvider.

https://github.com/angular-translate/angular-translate/blob/d548b0351f75e6a36991319305ea2d122f2c2f37/src/translate.js#L18
I think it seems to string | ITranslateProvider. TypeScript can't provide union types...

You are sure?
https://github.com/angular-translate/angular-translate/blob/2.3.0/src/service/translate.js#L313
The file you mentioned is very old.
the return type for this one should be `this` and not `ITranslateProvider` see https://github.com/angular-translate/angular-translate/blob/master/src/service/translate.js#L251

~~actually I was trying to cover next quit https://github.com/angular-translate/angular-translate/blob/master/src/service/translate.js#L243~~

~~and i thought that return type for it would be same as for https://github.com/angular-translate/angular-translate/blob/master/src/service/translate.js#L238 thats why `ITranslationTable` was used.. However I may be wrong~~

Oh, I got what line you are talking about. but I do not know if there is any difference between `ITranslateProvider` and `this` when we are "inside" `ITranslateProvider` interface. maybe someone else can shed some light on that..
